titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Journal of Experimental Zoology Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:33

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records include correspondence, financial papers, minutes, and miscellanea relating to the publication and operation of the Journal of Experimental Zoology. Correspondence with editorial board members, contributors, and members of the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology document the daily activities of the journal's staff. Correspondents include; Edwin Grant Conklin, Jacques Loeb, Charles Rupert Stockard, Ross Granville Harrison, and John Spangler Nicholas.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Journal of Experimental Zoology Records (MS 1098). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Department of Zoology, Yale University, 1966; and transferred from the John Spangler Nicholas Papers (MS 929), 1984.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Associated material: John Spangler Nicholas Papers (MS 929), (Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series: I. Correspondence, 1894-1964. II. Office Files, 1891-1947.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Journal of Experimental Zoology was founded in 1904 by Ross Granville Harrison, Merkel H. Jacobs, and others in Baltimore, Maryland. A private corporation was formed and was responsible for the publication until December, 1932, when the corporation was dissolved and the journal came under the supervision of the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The journal was printed in Baltimore from 1904 to 1908 at Williams and Wilkins Company, and from 1908 to the present by the Wistar Institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records include correspondence, financial papers, minutes, and miscellanea relating to the publication and operation of the Journal of Experimental Zoology. Correspondence with editorial board members, contributors, and members of the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology document the daily activities of the journal's staff. Correspondents include; Edwin Grant Conklin, Jacques Loeb, Charles Rupert Stockard, Ross Granville Harrison, and John Spangler Nicholas.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For an index of manuscripts in this collection and their authors, and for a listing of correspondence, please consult theCollection Inventory.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.p: This series is arranged in five sections: General, Select, Editorial Board, Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology, and Manuscripts.

scopecontent.p: This series is arranged in four sections: Financial records, Minutes of stockholders' meetings, Record of manuscripts, and Miscellanea.
